timeline.bodyText: There's no need to check whether we timed out here, since we effectively abort all of the point-in-time merges we created by setting includeMergeReader to false below, right? I wonder if it would be cleaner to eliminate this AtomicBoolean that is shared with this and the merge threads, and instead using the existing merge abort technique that we have? OTOH IDK how that other mechanism works - is it aborting all outstanding merges?
timeline.author: msokolov

replies.bodyText: we actually never abort these merges. there is no reason why we should do that. we might have done most of the work, we only abort merges if we shutdown our writers. I hope that makes sense?
replies.author: s1monw

replies.bodyText: OK, I misunderstood the usage of includeMergeReader. I guess the idea is that we let them continue, but keep the original (merging) segments in the reader we're opening, so we do need a separate condition for that
